poem:
### The Blame Game

In the shadow of wings clipped by folly,  
He shifts weight, feathered in evasion,  
Pointing the weather-vein finger of guilt  
To skies where clouds bear his image.  
Yet in the echo of engines and ambition,  
A truth grounded seeks its own ascent,  
Whispering through the wreckage,  
Silent as a prayer unanswered.
